intro: Livistona crustacea, commonly known as the crusty palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, thick, and often scaly leaves. The plant typically grows as a solitary stem with a rosette of leaves that are dark green and covered in a waxy, crust-like layer. Livistona crustacea is well adapted to arid environments and can survive in poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
